titles.title: To authorize the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of Mongolia.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/10/1997--Introduced. Authorizes the President to: (1) determine that title IV of the Trade Act of 1974 (denying nondiscriminatory treatment to the products of certain countries) should no longer apply to Mongolia; and (2) based upon such determination, extend nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to Mongolian products.
